intro: Eurycentrum salomonense, commonly known as the Solomon Islands starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the Solomon Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palm-like appearance, with a single trunk and large, waxy leaves. It produces showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by small, edible fruits resembling starfruits. The plant is adapted to humid, tropical climates and thrives in well-drained soil.
